document.title: National Health Education Standards and Minnesota Benchmarks

E2A20D6A80AC495F866DEE96B107B0A2.description: The student will identify safe behaviors in the home, school, and community.

16D2FDB3A01346649D586D7024C6D11A.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to advocate for personal, family, and community health.

2282934C13614B72A9BB3509A4E5EB79.description: The student will identify responsible health behaviors.

79FA4D5FAC4345C19542293887A63E26.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and avoid or reduce health risks.

91D57CBD14D443D190B59AF6D0C1FADC.description: The student will identify skills in problem solving and decision making.

7455EF0C18AC42B890906E6A25044930.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.

6DA21C8B21234DCB9A6237C1A50A7371.description: The student will show healthy ways to express needs, wants, and feelings.

70C2B36AE27F4452A3B8D0527651F50A.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health and avoid or reduce health risks.

72121E36459244E380982287900C9E46.description: The student will demonstrate the ability to locate school and community health helpers.

9E89582FD2944270832518506B7C1EED.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to access valid information and products and services to enhance health.

0CC7204F6C9648E5A0C9534B0222FEE4.description: The student will explain how information and how we spend our time influences health.

C04C9274D70348199C0ACC7B82C31EA6.description: Students will analyze the influence of culture, media, technology, and other factors on health behaviors.

A6D44374004C4C98BDDEAFFF16387F17.description:
The student will describe how the family influences personal health.
  • Alcohol and Other Drugs
  • Community and Environmental Health
  • Family Life and Sexuality
  • Injury Prevention
  • Mental Health
  • Nutrition
  • Personal and Consumer Health
  • Physical Activity
  • Tobacco

DB4E98254B0A459A8B155C50D5D20EBA.description:
The student will describe how individual behavior affects individual health.
  • Alcohol and Other Drugs
  • Community and Environmental Health
  • Family Life and Sexuality
  • Injury Prevention
  • Mental Health
  • Nutrition
  • Personal and Consumer Health
  • Physical Activity
  • Tobacco

6329D4E423234913B5F88EE9BF5835A8.description: Students will comprehend concepts related to health promotion and disease prevention to enhance health.
